entity.name: OpenRefine
entity.description: OpenRefine is a free, powerful tool for working with messy data and improving it. Our mission is to empower everyone to meaningfully engage with data by providing an accessible open source tool and nurturing a diverse, supportive community. OpenRefine is a fiscally sponsored project of Code for Science & Society, a 501(c)(3) charitable organization in the USA. Donations are tax-deductible to the extent allowed by US law (Tax ID: 81-3791683).

projects.name: OpenRefine
projects.description: OpenRefine is funded by grants and gifts from institutions and individuals like you. Our annual operating budget is US$140 000 (or appx US$11,500 per month) to support our core team for maintenance, coordination, licensing, and administration. Details on fund usage and other sources of funding are available on our funding page (https://openrefine.org/funding). We would like to thanks our current donors (https://openrefine.org/backers).

plans.name: Up to $500 - Sustainer Level
plans.description: Covers essential day-to-day infrastructure including forum hosting, software licenses, and routine maintenance.

plans.name: Up to $5,000 - Sponsor Level
plans.description: Enables us to represent OpenRefine at conferences and expand our community outreach.

plans.name: Up to $50,000 - Sustainer Partner
plans.description: Underwrites multiple months of core-team development, feature work, and contributor support.

plans.name: Over $50,000 - Patron Level
plans.description: Fully sustains OpenRefine's annual budget, funding our entire core team for a full year.
